byline.contributor: Alan Rappeport and Maggie Haberman contributed reporting.
byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS, MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ASHLEY PARKER

abstract: Democratic and Republican leaders move to reign in Sen Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump, respectively, as two outsider candidates continue to roil party establishments; Pres Obama is set to meet Sanders in effort to promote party unity and get him to back presumptive nominee Hillary Clinton, and Republicans hope to convince Trump to make fewer incendiary statements.
lead_paragraph: President Obama is expected to meet with Mr. Sanders as part of an effort to ease him out of the race, while Republicans were seeking a more subdued version of Mr. Trump.

headline.main: As Democrats Nudge Bernie Sanders, G.O.P. Tries to Rein In Donald Trump
headline.print_headline: Parties’ Leaders Work to Rein in Their Renegades

snippet: President Obama is expected to meet with Mr. Sanders as part of an effort to ease him out of the race, while Republicans were seeking a more subdued version of Mr. Trump.
